Package dev.kkorolyov.pancake.core.component.movement

Class Damping

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.kkorolyov.pancake.core.component.movement.Damping
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.entity.Component

    public class Damping
extends java.lang.Object
implements dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.entity.Component
    Damping applied on an entity. Damping values are in the interval [0, 1], essentially translating to [immediate stop, no damping].

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Damping​(float damping)
      Constructs a new damping component with equal damping across all axes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.math.Vector damp​(dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.math.Vector velocity, dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.math.Vector force)
      Damps a velocity vector along axes where applied force is zero or in the opposite direction of velocity.
      dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.math.Vector getDamping​()
      If altering damping values, it is recommended to avoid altering this vector directly, and instead use one of the setDamping(float) methods, which constrain parameter values.
      void setDamping​(float damping)  
      void setDamping​(float dx, float dy)
      Sets x and y axes values while retaining the z-axis value.
      void setDamping​(float dx, float dy, float dz)
      All values are constrained in the interval [0, 1].

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Damping

        public Damping​(float damping)
        Constructs a new damping component with equal damping across all axes.
        Parameters:
        damping - damping along all axes

    • Method Detail

      • damp

        public dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.math.Vector damp​(dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.math.Vector velocity,
                                                       dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.math.Vector force)
        Damps a velocity vector along axes where applied force is zero or in the opposite direction of velocity. Damping is done by multiplying a velocity component by the respective damping component, so, the smaller the damping value, the greater the decrease in velocity.
        Parameters:
        velocity - damped velocity
        force - applied force
        Returns:
        velocity after damping applied

      • getDamping

        public dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.math.Vector getDamping​()
        If altering damping values, it is recommended to avoid altering this vector directly, and instead use one of the setDamping(float) methods, which constrain parameter values.
        Returns:
        damping vector
        See Also:
        setDamping(float, float, float)

      • setDamping

        public void setDamping​(float damping)
        Parameters:
        damping - new x, y, and z axes damping

      • setDamping

        public void setDamping​(float dx,
                       float dy)
        Sets x and y axes values while retaining the z-axis value.
        Parameters:
        dx - new x-axis damping
        dy - new y-axis damping

      • setDamping

        public void setDamping​(float dx,
                       float dy,
                       float dz)
        All values are constrained in the interval [0, 1].
        Parameters:
        dx - new x-axis damping
        dy - new y-axis damping
        dz - new z-axis damping
